programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: 2024 Player's Top Ten Fueled by Gatorade
programme.desc: Join Paul Carcaterra and Ryan Boyle in studio as they break down the top ten of this year's Player's Top 50 Fueled by Gatorade.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: University of Texas Documentary
programme.desc: 3 years ago, pro lacrosse player Kyle Hartzell stepped on the campus of University of Texas at Austin as their new club lacrosse team head coach. Now they are a top MCLA program competing for championships. TLN went to Austin, TX during the most anticipated game of the Longhorn's season to uncover what makes their program so special.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: TLN Facility Tours
programme.desc: Johns Hopkins & Clemson: Explore two top-tier lacrosse programs as TLN takes you inside their world-class facilities. Visit Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, home to the legendary Blue Jays, and tour the iconic Cordish Lacrosse Center and Homewood Field. Then, head to Clemson, SC, for an exclusive look at the nation's premier women's lacrosse facilities.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We head to Denver, CO to profile Ethan Walker: arguably the greatest shooter in college lacrosse. While also uncovering why the storied success of the Denver program has been fueled by top Canadian talent. We also went to Princeton to uncover the speed and power of Michael Sowers: An attackman who's mental approach to the game has risen him to record-breaking success within a program built on legendary offensive lacrosse players.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: We travel to Loyola University to breakdown the basketball influenced playing style of Pat Spencer – While storying his evolution to becoming arguably the best playmaker in college lacrosse. We also travel to Albany to explore the Danes' attack factory led by Connor Fields and Tehoka Nanticoke this spring. We learn how these guys came to lacrosse, the coaching philosophy of Scott Marr, and how the Thompsons laid the groundwork for a new style of play in upstate New York.

programme.title: Losing Is Worse Than Death | The Bill Tierney Documentary
programme.desc: Coach Bill Tierney is a legend. Over his five decade coaching career, he's accomplished almost everything: NCAA Championships, Coach of the Year honors, induction into the Hall of Fame. The last accomplishment left for his resume? A PLL Championship. Philadelphia finished 2-8 in Coach Tierney's inaugural year at the helm. Now in his second season, Tierney is aiming to right the ship and has his sights on one more ring.

programme.title: wsop-2024-be-ev-55-250k-nlh-shr-day3
programme.desc: Watch the final table of Event #55: $250,000 Super High Roller from the 2024 World Series of Poker.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A quadriplegic woman loved by her community is found dead in an Orlando park 150ft from her motorized wheelchair. Children find her lifeless body face down in the sand.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G reviews a woman's medical records and learns that that she suffered from an auto-immune disease called lupus, which might have something to do with her death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jerra Kirby, who's visiting family in Orlando, has suddenly passed out at a theme park wave pool and the paramedics are trying desperately to revive her.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G preforms an autopsy on an alleged hit-and-run victim but finds no evidence of vehicular injury on the 41-year-old man's body. Could his alcoholism have had a role in his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 94-year-old woman dies in the hospital after having a convulsion. The case becomes the business of the medical examiner's office when no one will sign her death certificate.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A healthy 53-year-old woman is found dead in bed. After performing an autopsy and taking blood and tissue samples, Dr. G cannot find the cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired businessman travels from England to Florida to visit his family but dies soon after arriving. Dr. G must now determine what mysteriously killed this healthy man so suddenly.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Manny Alvarez mysteriously crashes his car into a fence. He dies en route to the hospital, leaving behind a wife and son. It is up to Dr. G to find out what cut this young man's life short.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's leg pain turns out to be flesh-eating virus, threatening life and limb; a Desert Storm war veteran swallows razor blades on a dare; a bride-to-be spends her wedding day in the ER after collapsing at the altar.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A man goes into anaphylactic shock, a tough guy fears needles and a man stabs himself with a ninja sword.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Dr. Castillo thought he had seen it all until the day a seven-foot man comes in blind drunk and unconscious.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A boy is rushed in after breathing in an unspecified poisonous chemical. Has it permanently damaged his lungs?

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Seven-year-old Brian has been hit by a truck and his arm has been ripped off.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A car with teen girls crashes into a fence, with a pole shooting through the windshield and into the driver.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A mugging victim arrives with two bullet wounds to the brain.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: A policeman is struck by a speeding driver seeking revenge, which may leave him with no legs.

programme.title: Untold Stories of the ER
programme.desc: Crisis breaks out in the ER when a depressed man walks in, pulls out a gun and takes a doctor hostage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team head to Birmingham for one of the highlights of the horticultural calendar: the annual Gardeners' World Live event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into some seasonal jobs. Arit Anderson and Nick Bailey present highlights from RHS Flower Show Tatton Park, and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out annuals in the jewel garden, adds agapanthus to the mound and finds a new home for his pelargoniums. Adam Frost visits an innovative kitchen garden at the Spurs training centre in North London, which provides fresh produce for its players, coaches and staff. In Wiltshire, Carol Klein's at a glorious early summer garden which employs clever use of curves, circles and spheres in its evergreen planting.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out sweetcorn, checks in on his container veg and creates a display with fuchsias. Nick Bailey visits a nurserywoman and gardener in Cheshire who uses perennials as the stars of the garden to provide interest throughout the year. With only a few weeks to go, Sue Kent shares an update on the progress of her first ever show garden, destined for the Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. And there's a gardener in Somerset who couldn't live without roses in her garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardeners' World comes from the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Joe Swift reveal the highlights of the show gardens, meet the designers and growers and share the season's must have flowers and plants on display.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A frozen pond and snow drifts would be so cold, except for the warm rich sky and late autumn foliage in this Bob Ross painting.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: Beach Hunters

programme.title: Beach Hunters

programme.title: Beach Hunters

programme.title: Beach Hunters
programme.desc: A family of seven hunts for a beach home on the shores of Navarre, FL.

programme.title: Beach Hunters

programme.title: Beach Hunters

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Follow retired veteran Kevin Keim as he embarks on a whitetail deer hunt of a lifetime, awarded through the annual Bucks for the Brave event—an initiative honoring America’s heroes.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explains the domestic trade in exotic wildlife and how some of our planet’s most threatened species are being protected by the practice.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor launch out of Key Largo and fish their way up a creek filled with monsters.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Tony Young for a day of offshore fishing and free diving out of Islamorada.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair heads down to Miami with Capt. Brett Isackson in search of a bass normally found in South America.

programme.title: We Caught That
programme.desc: In this episode, Capt. Jason Dozier teams up with (name) to chase the elusive Hogfish. With the Hogfish proving elusive, they manage to turn the day into a success, filling the box with an impressive haul and reeling in a few massive catches along the way.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Last season in Part one Rochelle Partridge passed up a monster framed 8, rolling the dice hoping that through small odds that the buck could survive another year. This week shows just what a year can do.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: Brian Smith makes his thid trip to Canadian Whitetail Outfitters hoping on his third northern whitetail.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A packed episode with 3 hunts from the Hayworth Family with some wild footage of BIG Whitetails.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip back to Southwest Florida to chase after Redfish and Snook. Plus, a special tour of the Costa Custom Boat Factory

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the space coast for a mixed bag of drum.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to Jupiter to fish with Ryan Nitz for giant snook.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the yellowtail at the islands refuse to play, it’s time to switch up the game plan. Ali and Rush pivot north of San Diego in search of hard-charging bluefin tuna during a multi-day mission aboard the 43’ custom ACI Catamaran "Killer Bee". Armed with the right crew, the right gear, and a never-quit mindset, the guys roll the dice on an overnight move—hoping to wake up to redemption and put a few quality bluefin on deck.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins his long time friend Capt. Jake Roth for a day of fishing in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From South Florida to North West Central Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss is chasing fish and dodging the weather!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker fishes out of Hawks Cay with fellow Duck Key resident Captain Ariel Medero catching Blackfin Tunas and big Queen Snappers.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger chase the full moon Wahoo bite fishing out of Plantation Boat Mart.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker heads swordfishing out of Hawks Cay with his friend, retired WWE wrestler Travis Tomko.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Ariel Medero fish with David Moss from the Nature Conservancy out of Hawks Cay sampling the bottom fishing and deep dropping. In between the action they learn about the Nature Conservancy’s mission to promote sustainable and transparent fishing practices.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Today we’re talking with Nick Haddad about his innovative fishing conservation initiative, "Return 'Em Right," focused on boosting the survival rates of reef fish caught and released in the Gulf of Mexico. Teaming up with Florida Sea Grant, University of Florida, Gulf States Marine Fisheries Commission, NOAA, and a diverse coalition of partners, the project delivers training, equipment, and research funding to tackle depredation and release mortality issues. Moreover, it evaluates the efficacy of descending devices, ultimately promoting improved fish survival, a more robust fishery, and enriched angling experiences across the Gulf of Mexico.This podcast is presented by Black Rifle Coffee Use code BLASTOFF25 for 25% offSalt Strong Insiders Club: https://bit.ly/RowlandMembershipLMNT Electrolytes Special Offer: http://DrinkLMNT.com/TomRowlandIf you have questions or suggestions for the show you can text Tom at 1 305-930-7346This episode has been brought to you by Waypoint TV. programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny joins True North Trout and Koz as they hit the Manistee River for a bit of trout fishing on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at being a guide on the Manistee River with Koz. Then later Danny tries his fly fishing skills on the Crystal River to see if he can land a monster salmon on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny brings his buddy Ryan to Port St. Joe for scalloping season. They hook up with Guillermo from Blacks Island to show them how it’s done.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by Ryan Sheffield for some fishing on Cape San Blas. They meet up with Mark Moore to go fishing for Reds and Trout. Later, they cook up the catch.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell sit down to discuss the week No. 1 ups and downs, and what they learned during their first run hunting public ducks up north.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Scouting before the season pays off as Dr. Duck finds the Mother Load on Public Land. Mallards are stacked in like cord wood now they just have to get the hole before someone else. It's a sprint to the hole!! Six states are represented for one of the most epic opening day Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell have ever seen. You don't want to miss this one!!!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join seasoned anglers Danny Allen and Greg Devault as they embark on an exhilarating fishing expedition along the serene waters of the Econfina River and the breathtaking Gulf Coast. In this thrilling TV show, watch as Danny and Greg tackle the challenges of reeling in trophy fish while exploring the diverse ecosystems and hidden gems of these picturesque locales. With expert tips, breathtaking scenery, and unforgettable moments, this fishing adventure promises excitement and inspiration for anglers of all levels. Tune in to witness the excitement unfold on the waters of the Econfina River and the Gulf Coast with Danny Allen and Greg Devault!

programme.title: Beyond The Surface
programme.desc: Join Captain Danny Allen and Hall of Fame winner Leiza Fitzgerald of CCA Florida Star as the 2 veteran anglers mix tactics and tackle ideas in the Steinhatchee flats! Join in while they fish through some foggy cool weather and teach transitional ways to consistently put fish in the boat while sharing some CCA Star Tournament details for 2024!!

We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.desc: Long inhabited by human settlers, the Red Planet has become the manifest destiny of an over-populated Earth. Nearly 640,000 people now live and work all over Mars, mining the planet for its abundant natural resources. But one of those mining operations has uncovered a deadly mother lode: a long-dormant Martian civilization whose warriors are systematically taking over the bodies of human intruders.

programme.title: 28 Days
programme.desc: A disastrous drunken episode lands a successful New York journalist in rehab where she encounters a bizarre assortment of characters and rituals.

programme.title: The Beast
programme.desc: The stress of war and the constant threat of death and betrayal plagues a Soviet tank crew at odds with each other while lost in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After bounty hunter Milo learns that his next target is his ex-wife Nicole, the two become entangled in a contentious web of games.

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: The sci-fi splatter hit about a military crew of men and women forced into an intergalactic war against a relentless and violent alien species.

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: The hit horror romp about the jungle nightmare a documentary crew in the Amazon experiences when they’re stalked by a ravenous 40-foot anaconda.

programme.title: Colombiana
programme.desc: An orphaned girl grows up to become a professional assassin working for her uncle, always hoping to hunt down the mobster behind her parents’ deaths.

programme.title: It Happened to Jane
programme.desc: When a shipment of expired shellfish arrives to her New England lobstery, Jane Osgood decides to take a capitalist railroad tycoon to court.

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit
programme.desc: When a pair of Martians steal a powerful submarine-tank-rocket military weapon from an inventor, the Three Stooges step in to try to save the day.

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: The Harder They Fall
programme.desc: Broke and without work, newspaper reporter Eddie Willis (Humphrey Bogart) agrees to work for the corrupt boxing promoter Nick Benko (Rod Steiger) to help hype his new boxer, Toro Moreno (Mike Lane). While Toro is beastly in appearance, he has no actual boxing talent, and all his fights are fixed. When Toro gets a shot at the title against the brutal Buddy Brannen (Max Baer), Willis is faced with the tough decision of whether or not to tell Toro that his entire career is a sham.

programme.title: Oliver!
programme.desc: In 1830s London, orphan Oliver Twist escapes to join a band of young pickpockets led by the sly Fagin in this musical take on Dickens' classic tale.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Black Noon
programme.desc: In the Old West, a young, traveling minister and his wife get caught up in a web of witchcraft involving a mute beauty and a satanic gunfighter.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: Brazos Kane, a gunslinger who's vowed to kill no more, goes to work for a land baron on a ranch, where he is unjustly accused of murder.

programme.title: Blackjack Ketchum, Desperado
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Howard Duff) wants peace in the valley, but a cattle baron (Victor Jory) and his brothers want war.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: Pecos River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) catch mail robbers.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: California Frontier
programme.desc: An Army captain (Buck Jones) fights land-grabbers and woos a Mexican beauty (Carmen Bailey) in California.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: Major Dundee
programme.desc: During the end of the Civil War, Major Dundee guards Confederate prisoners, Union deserters and ordinary hard-bitten criminals in a remote fort. When Apaches attack the fort and make off with three children, Dundee must set up a posse including Confederates, who face a choice between joining up or being shot. The feud between Dundee and Tyreen is also heated up by a sultry Mexican widow.

programme.title: Smoky Canyon
programme.desc: The masked Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) settles a feud between cattlemen and sheepmen.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.title: Room for One More
programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: True story of Father Flanagan's fight to build a home for orphaned boys.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: Nick, Nora and their terrier somehow always seem to crack their case.

programme.title: Three Godfathers
programme.desc: Fugitives risk their lives to bring a baby out of the desert to safety.

programme.title: Doctor X
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a series of cannibalistic murders at a college.

programme.title: She
programme.desc: Explorers uncover a lost kingdom ruled by an immortal queen.

programme.title: The Human Comedy
programme.desc: A small-town telegraph boy deals with growing up during World War II.

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: A shop girl is mistaken for the mother of a foundling.

programme.title: Tortilla Flat
programme.desc: Inhabitants of a California village strive for the simple pleasures.

programme.title: The Hypnotic Eye
programme.desc: A city is stricken by a wave of horrific self-mutilations.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain
programme.desc: A Confederate troop makes a desperate attempt to build an army in the West.

programme.title: Horror of Dracula
programme.desc: After finding his missing friend undead in Dracula’s crypt, vampire hunter Van Helsing must save his pal’s frail fiancée from the count’s next bite.

programme.title: Juarez
programme.desc: The true story of Mexico's Abe Lincoln and his fight against the French.

programme.title: The Belle of New York
programme.desc: A turn-of-the-century playboy courts a Salvation Army girl.

programme.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
programme.desc: Two brothers love the same woman at a perilous Indian outpost.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Catherine informs Five-0 that McGarrett's mother has been captured and is in danger of being executed for trying to free Wo Fat's imprisoned father; Chin is unable to delay Sara's adoption.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: While Danny chaperones Grace's high school dance, the venue is seized by terrorists, who hold everyone hostage with the intent of abducting a diplomat's son; Danny and Grover discover that Will is Grace's secret boyfriend.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A conspiracy theorist with compelling information that JFK's own cabinet planned his assassination is murdered.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A boy suffering from PTSD undergoes hypnosis and realizes he may have witnessed a murder related to a 10-year-old cold case; Danny's sister visits Oahu.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team rushes to Mexico, where Chin puts his life in jeopardy in an effort to rescue Sara, his kidnapped niece.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Chin is kidnapped by a Mexican cartel, Five-0 must rescue him before he is executed by the vengeful group; Grover goes under cover to investigate a murder, which turns out to be far more complex and dangerous than anticipated.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: While Max prepares to say his goodbyes, the team investigates a murder during a police convention on the island.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team faces a contentious U.S. Marshall after a murder suspect escapes capture and looks for asylum in the sovereign land that belongs to the Nation of Hawaii.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: While working a murder case, Five-0 discovers that a former Nazi war criminal may be hiding out in an old leprosy colony in Hawaii.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: While McGarrett and Danno celebrate Valentine's Day with their girlfriends, the Five-0 team investigates the murder of a man taking a class on how to meet women.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The Five-0 must once again engage in the twisted mind games of serial killer Dr. Madison Gray when she arrives at the HPD covered in blood that matches Alicia Brown's.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: After tracking down the missing uranium, which has been used to build a bomb in the middle of the jungle, McGarrett and Danny must move the explosive material through treacherous terrain before it detonates.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and Kono suspect that an abused young girl may be the victim of a sex trafficking ring on the Island; Chin and Grover investigate a murder at a sober living facility.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The Five-0 helps a private investigator in the case of a kidnapped woman whose husband may have something to hide; Rachel tells Danny that she is getting a divorce from Stan.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and the Five-0 are captured while tracking a dangerous nemesis to the island of Lanai; Grover takes his son to Chicago, where he testifies against a dirty cop.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: On election day, someone tries to create turmoil in the U.S. presidential election, and Team Scorpion is called to investigate.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: While in Ireland for Megan's one-year memorial, Walter discovers a natural disaster at a nearby lake has created a poisonous cloud that threatens an entire village; Cabe and Toby try to ease the tension between Tim and Walter.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: When Paige's estranged mother stumbles upon a forgotten nuclear reactor precariously close to exploding, she calls on the team for help.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Walter takes a perilous swim to rescue a woman trapped in the La Brea tar pits; Paige's mother maximizes Ralph's troop cookie sales.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates multiple murders tied to a construction company that creates an experimental chemical that strengthens sea walls; evidence from Hannah's previous mission in Oman is used against her.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After an elusive terrorist with a personal vendetta against Hannah resurfaces, she and her family are placed in protective custody while the team searches for the suspect.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After a reshuffling of assignments, Pride returns to the New Orleans office during the investigation of a missing petty officer.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of Patton's friend, a former Navy SEAL gunned down in a drive-by shooting while Patton watched.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant from a well-connected and affluent family has a fatal fall down a flight of stairs at a charity gala; the team investigates whether his death was an accident or foul play.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Elvis Bertrand's "daughter" is linked to a murder case, he asks Pride to prove her innocence.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy is convinced that a con man committed the hit-and-run murder of a Navy doctor, even though the evidence shows otherwise; unbeknownst to Hannah, her husband approaches Pride with new intel on an underground spy network.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates a deadly bombing at a military museum event with over 1,000 people in attendance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and Lasalle travel to war-torn South Ossetia to locate an FBI agent who was kidnapped during a failed mission to apprehend the leader of Apollyon, the underground spy network responsible for murdering Pride's father.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After tracking Apollyon, a deadly underground spy network, to war-torn South Ossetia, Pride is separated from the team and faces grave danger; in order to save Pride, the NCIS team must locate a mole who continues to feed information to Apollyon.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride must cut his vacation short when Hannah is suspended for breaking protocol during a joint investigation with the FBI.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy pilot says she saw an unidentified object prior to a private plane crash; Pride suffers from insomnia and nightmares as a result of being kidnapped and drugged last year.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride travels to New York City after new DNA evidence is linked to a 20-year-old cold case from his past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny lets painter Ryan take the lead on a 1959 Chevy Panel Truck project he hopes to flip, and later motivates his crew to clean up the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Shannon recruits the guys to help him finish up a gift for Danny, a bike he started building for him- ten years ago. Meanwhile, Danny spots a 1969 Corvette in a friend's lot.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Count's Kustoms has had its most successful year to date.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny charges Ryan with customizing a brand new Chevy Silverado for their most difficult customer--himself!

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and his crew look at some of the most classic rides in the history of Counting Cars: a museum worthy 1914 Model T pie wagon; a 1960 Cadillac coupe; a tricked out '35 Ford pickup street rod; a 1953 Henry J Corsair.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Pawn Stars Rick Harrison shows up to give the guys of Count s Kustoms the project of a lifetime.

programme.desc: A couple from Miami enlists Danny and the Counts Kustom crew to raise money and awareness to combat a very rare disease.

programme.desc: Tasked with building a custom bike for a disabled man, Danny and his team must figure out a way to tackle a tricky transformation.

programme.desc: Danny discovers the rarest Cadillac collection he's ever seen. Later, Horny Mike has 30 days to move his big ugly bus.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Everyone is revved up and ready to go as Barrett-Jackson continues in Palm Beach, Fla.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Some of the most unique and sought-after vehicles make their way across the Barrett-Jackson auction block including a special Hendricks edition Camaro whose massive sale supports a great cause.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Cars continue to roll down the block as Barrett-Jackson makes a stop in Scottsdale, Ariz., to celebrate 50 years of cars.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: As the auction continues, the attention shifts to resto mods and originals ranging from Pre-War Cadillacs to Early 2000's Ferraris. The extraordinary evolution of these models is put on display as they drive across the auction block.

programme.desc: The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions return to Scottsdale, Ariz., with an incredible lineup of classics, trucks, customs, and celebrity-owned vehicles selling at no reserve.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby hits the lake with a squad of assistants to have one last confrontation with Richard; the Dreadknots and S&S struggle to pull enough logs to help out their ailing leader; Gord's final site offers lethal challenges.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes on a treasure-hunting mission and ends up in a race against Belinda; Jesse's lesson on the whistles almost takes Luke out; S&S continues to struggle; the Dreadknots' lucky charm gets destroyed.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby finds a legendary old grave site and the crew has an accident; Levi decides to make some major crew changes; Brad and Swilley are the victims of a prank and they lose yet another assistant; Joe and Coatsy have a tough time keeping steady work.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries out a new assistant and meets his match; Brad has an MMA title fight; the entire Big Gun crew heads out to cut the next road in high winds; Craig drops a bomb.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby and DaVi are reunited for a mission to help the people of New Orleans; the Big Gun crew scrambles to finish up the Grindstone site; Gord gets greedy and loses a load of logs; Craig loses his cool.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby gives DaVi a very unusual gift; Gabe Rygaard rushes his crew to finish a site; Joe and Coatsy get a job in Alaska; Brad decides to take a risk and dives into a river cave.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Brad and Swilley lose a fight with massive log; while gar fishing with his cousin the Swamp Man finds what could be the log raft.

programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dying his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis. Jase's help turns into a competition amongst the Robertson brothers to see who is most fit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane" to different places.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a planned date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from--Godwin's House.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.
